Element: 1. Woman in Consecrated or Transitional State
Dinah: Genesis 34:1 – “And Dinah the daughter of Leah... went out to see the daughters of the land.”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:11 – “Then said Judah to Tamar... Remain a widow at thy father's house.”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:7 – “And David sent home to Tamar, saying, Go now to thy brother Amnon's house...”
Concubine: Judges 19:2 – “And his concubine played the whore against him, and went away unto her father's house...”
Rahab: Joshua 6:25 – “And Joshua saved Rahab the harlot alive... and she dwelleth in Israel even unto this day...”

Dinah: Genesis 34:31 – “Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:15 – “He thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:17 – “Then he called his servant... and said, Put now this woman out from me...”
Concubine: Judges 19:2 – “And his concubine played the whore against him...”
Rahab: Joshua 2:1 – “...and came into an harlot’s house, named Rahab, and lodged there.”

Dinah: Genesis 34:2 – “Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country...”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:18 – “Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff...”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:18 – “...a garment of divers colours... for with such robes were the king’s daughters...”
Concubine: Judges 19:3 – “...and his servant with him, and a couple of asses...”
Rahab: Joshua 2:18 – “...bind this line of scarlet thread in the window...”

Dinah: Genesis 34:25 – “Two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah's brethren, took each man his sword...”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:12 – “Judah... went up... he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:3 – “But Amnon had a friend, whose name was Jonadab...”
Concubine: Judges 19:3 – “Then her husband arose... and his servant with him...”
Rahab: Joshua 2:1 – “Joshua... sent... two men to spy secretly...”

Element: 5. Woman Moved Between Houses or States
Dinah: Genesis 34:26 – “They took Dinah out of Shechem's house, and went out.”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:11 – “Remain a widow at thy father's house...”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:10 – “And Amnon said unto Tamar, Bring the meat into the chamber...”
Concubine: Judges 19:3 – “...and spake friendly unto her, to bring her again...”
Rahab: Joshua 6:23 – “...and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren...”

Dinah: Genesis 34:13 – “And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully...”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:14 – “...put her widow's garments off... and sat in an open place...”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:6 – “Amnon lay down, and made himself sick...”
Concubine: Judges 20:29–32 – “And Israel set liers in wait round about... feigned to flee before the men of Benjamin...”
Rahab: Joshua 2:4 – “And the woman took the two men, and hid them...”

Dinah: Genesis 34:7 – “...because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter...”
Tamar (Judah): Genesis 38:24 – “Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.”
Tamar (David): 2 Samuel 13:12 – “Nay, my brother, do not force me... for no such thing ought to be done in Israel.”
Concubine: Judges 20:10 – “According to all the folly that they have wrought in Israel.”
Rahab: Joshua 7:15 – “Because he hath wrought folly in Israel...”
